title: Strategic Planning & Assessments, FMD Joint Capabilities Training Office
company: Unites States Special Operations Command (Retiring / Transitioning)
description: I serve as the US Special Operations Command, Directorate for Force Management & Development, Joint Capabilities Training Office, Director for Strategic Planning & Assessments. I developed a concept to consolidate the disparate SOF Training and Exercise elements across the world and established the USSOCOM Enterprise Wide Training and Exercise Program (UEWTEP). The UEWTEP program consolidates the SOF collective training and exercises into an enterprise wide program, focused on increasing SOF readiness, effectiveness and efficient use of resources while increasing exercise support to the TSOCs and Components. I identify organizational and operational shortfalls and gaps and then develop roadmaps and strategies to eliminate them. The FMD JCTO provides a detailed understanding of SOF collecting training and exercise requirements, incorporating lessons learned and operational AARs and addressing readiness issues across the enterprise. The UEWTEP is aligned with the Commander’s Vision, Lines of Operation (LOOs) and will be fully integrated into the SPP with a consolidated Program Objective Memorandum (POM) 16, ensuring SOF are trained and ready to conduct assigned functions and wartime tasks. The UEWTEP will provide an enterprise level solution with management, oversight and transparency. I also serve on high level OPT / IPTs that address complex organizational issues.

title: Owner
description: Lawn care service and maintenance - Lawn care and weed control - Affordable pruning, trimming and maintenance for trees and shrubs- annual pruning program Yacht Hull Cleaning and Underwater Services, Master SCUBA Diver - Boat lift cleaning, dock cleaning, zinc replacement, propeller removal and installation, search and recovery, inspections, quality control, underwater photography. 1. Why do I need an underwater hull cleaning service? The obvious reason is to keep your boat bottom clean. 2. But why do I need to keep it clean? Regularly scheduled underwater hull cleaning is the single most important preventative maintenance service! 3. Why? First frequent underwater hull cleaning extends the life of your bottom paint. 4. How? First, by removing the algae slime layer before invertebrate (Hard growth) can attach and dig into the bottom paint. Second cleaning the painted surfaces is only part of the job. The diver must also tend to clean the unpainted metal parts of your vessel, primarily the running gear and thru hulls. Proper cleaning of the hull, running gear and thru hulls improves vessel performance and saves fuel costs. Keeping the thru hull intakes clear ensures proper performance of the various systems inside the vessel, engine, generator, head, air conditioner, refrigerator and galley. Third, another extremely important service provided by the underwater hull cleaning diver is tending to and replacing the sacrificial anodes (Zinc). The diver must inspect, tighten and periodically replace the various zinc anodes which protect the different metal parts of the vessel from galvanic corrosion (electrolysis). Fourth, during the hull cleaning process the diver inspects the hull and hardware as he cleans it for impact damages and electrolysis. He also monitors the fiberglass hull for osmotic blistering, the wood hull for worm damages and the steel or aluminum hull for electrolysis.

title: Zero Dark Thirty (film) - Actor/Advisor
description: www.zerodarkthirty-movie.com chronicles the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the 9/11 attacks, and his death at the hands of the Navy SEAL Team 6 in May, 2011. Director: Kathryn Bigelow, Writer: Mark Boal, Stars: Chris Pratt, Jessica Chastain and Joel Edgerton. The film is set to release 19 DEC 2012 (USA). Political controversy http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero_Dark_Thirty Opponents of the Obama Administration charged that Zero Dark Thirty was scheduled for an October release just before the November presidential election, so that it would support the reelection of Barack Obama by reminding the public who gave the command to initiate the raid that got bin Laden. The release date was set for December 19, 2012, well after the election and rendering moot any alleged political conflict. Several sources have also charged the Obama Administration of improperly providing Bigelow and her team access to classified information during their research for the film. These charges have become a prevalent election season conservative talking point, and have also found their way onto the Republican national convention party platform, which claims Obama "has tolerated publicizing the details of the operation to kill the leader of Al Qaeda." Conservative watchdog group Judicial Watch publicized CIA and DoD documents obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request, and alleged that "unusual access to agency information" was granted to the filmmakers. An examination of the documents showed no evidence that classified information was leaked to the filmmakers, and the CIA records did not show any involvement by the White House. The filmmakers have denied the claims they were given access to classified details about the killing of Osama bin Laden. A CIA spokesman confirmed the agency maintained their goal of "an accurate portrayal of the men and women of the CIA, their vital mission and the commitment to public service that defines them."

title: Green Zone (film) - Actor/Advisor
description: The Green Zone is the most common name for the International Zone of Baghdad. "Green Zone" (film) is a 2010 American war thriller film directed by Paul Greengrass. The storyline was conceived from a screenplay written by Brian Helgeland, based on a 2006 non-fiction book entitled Imperial Life in the Emerald City authored by journalist Rajiv Chandrasekaran. The novel documented life within the Green Zone in Baghdad during the 2003 invasion of Iraq. Actors Matt Damon and Greg Kinnear star in leading roles while the ensemble cast features Brendan Gleeson, Amy Ryan, Khalid Abdalla and Jason Isaacs. Political Controversy http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Green_Zone_(film): The film has received political criticism. Some have called it "anti-American" or "anti-war". An article on Rupert Murdoch's Fox News.com states, "Given this set-up, audiences are encouraged to root for Miller's rogue activities and against the government, represented in the film by a corrupt Pentagon chief played by Greg Kinnear." Richard "Monty" Gonzales, the person on whom the character of Roy Miller was loosely based, commented that both sides of the political spectrum have reacted disproportionately and any political controversy is unwarranted. Gonzales worked as one of the film's military advisors over two years on the condition that the film would be faithful to the experience of American soldiers in Iraq. Gonzales wrote that, on the one hand, the film captures the critical intelligence blunders prior to the war and de-Baathification program that ensured that the conflict was costly and complicated. He nevertheless maintains that a reading of the film that reflects a genuine conspiracy by sections of the American government is incorrect. He sees the film as an exciting "Bourne-in-Baghdad thriller". Matt Damon cites Gonzales' motives for working on the film as being "because we need to regain our moral authority." Paul Greengrass and Matt Damon both defended the film in interviews.

title: Babysitter
description: Care and protect children of any age, considering safety and well being of the children at all times. Watch a family's children for a few hours while the parents are away from the home. Provide a meal or snack for the children and find ways to entertain or engage the kids. Master the ability to multitask and manage time well. It takes both skills to keep a fun game going for the kids while fixing their dinner Responsible for following through with the family's bedtime routine, which could mean some great salesmanship skills to convince the kids to go to bed and stay in bed. The key to being a successful babysitter is to keep the kids safe and entertained in fun ways that do not always include watching TV or movies. An imaginative babysitter will really stand out. Cost of employment $25/hour for one child/family and an additional $5/hour for each additional child. Families are charged separately. Amy's Angels is now Mom's Day Off, but Amy Semler is still the owner. Since she is a sitting Agency, she does not have and address listed. title: Youth Conservation Corps (YCC) Trail Crew Leader
description: - Lead and organize groups of 6-10 volunteers to the back country of Yellowstone National Park to repair and maintain trails. - Facilitate the reconstruction of destroyed or damaged trails. - Work closely with National Park Rangers to build corrals for horses and pack mules, crush rocks for small stream crossings, install switch backs and drainage run offs to minimize the impact of erosion and prolong the life of high to low traffic trails. http://www.nps.gov/yell/parkmgmt/yccjobs.htm Yellowstone’s YCC program is challenging, educational, and fun, and offers participants opportunities to expand their horizons while building skills that will benefit them for a lifetime. A willingness and ability to work in a physically active outdoor program, get along well with others, and maintain a positive attitude are essential for success. Approximately 30 students are selected from across the country to participate in the park’s YCC Program. Enrollees work 40 hours a week. YCC participants work in a variety of weather and terrain conditions completing projects which include: painting/staining; exotic plant control; fence and bench building; general maintenance work; trail construction and/or maintenance; and, visitor center and other public service work. Some projects take place in remote backcountry locations within Yellowstone, requiring work crews to camp out for up to four days. When crews are based in the front country, they will stay at the YCC Camp near Mammoth Hot Springs which provides dormitory facilities and a large dining hall for meals and meetings. Enrollees participate in environmental education, recreation, and NPS and other agency career orientation activities. Many activities are scheduled in the evenings and on weekends. Activities may include: hiking, rafting, fishing, ranger-led programs, guest speakers, enrollee and staff presentations, assisting field rangers and/or scientists, and trips throughout the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem.

title: Corn Detasseler
description: Farm work is the most dangerous occupation in the US. But, for most people in “corn country” detasseling is not dangerous; it's merely dirty, uncomfortable and exhausting. Rare cases of injury and death have occurred. Detasseling corn is removing the pollen-producing flowers from the tops of corn plants and placing them on the ground. It is a form of pollination control, employed to cross-breed two varieties of corn. The field is first detasseled by machine and then manually. Detasseling is a common summer job. About three-fourths of detasselers are under age 16. The job is simply to remove the tassels. In addition to employing a large teenage workforce, some areas of the country employ migrant workers as detasselers. Detasseling work serves as a typical rite of passage in rural areas of the Corn Belt of the Midwestern US. For many teens it is their first job. The detasseling season typically lasts from 2-4 wks with work days varying from just a few hours to over 10 hours depending on the growing season. A usual day begins pre-dawn with a bus ride to fields, where typical attire includes a hat, safety glasses, long sleeved-shirt and bandana across the face. Teens who can tolerate the heat, humidity, scratchy corn leaves and allergens can earn hundreds of $$ over the course of a season. The dropout rate after one day of work is high -- some teens can't even make it through a full day. The survivors share the camaraderie that comes with overcoming hardship and achieving goals. It’s common to share memories of water fights and mud wrestling at the end of half-mile-long corn rows. Wages for detasselers vary greatly; some detasselers earn min wage (1994 value of min wage was $4.25). Individual wages depend on the seed corn company, the detasseling contractor, the experience of the detasseler and even the individual field conditions such as the number of plants per acre, percentage of the tassels pulled by a detasseling machine or the height of the corn.
